metadata.synopsis: Halsin's default in-party dialogue once you have him available as a companion. You recruit/dismiss him, and discuss an assortment of topics with him.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to Halsin once he's recruitable (progress through the lifting the curse quest until Halsin brings Thaniel to the player's camp, then speak to him there. Alternatively, use debug to add companions).

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: We need to find Oliver and get him to return to Thaniel. Otherwise this curse will never be lifted.

110.speaker: Halsin
110.text: It is done - now Thaniel will be whole again. I could not have done this without you, my friend.

134.speaker: Halsin
134.text: It is done - now Thaniel will be whole again. I could not have done this without you, my friend.

118.speaker: Halsin
118.text: We should return to camp when we can - I must see how Thaniel is faring. With the Oak Father's blessing, the shadow curse may soon be no more.

135.speaker: Halsin
135.text: Thaniel still needs our help - part of his essence must still be out there, somewhere.
135.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner

147.speaker: Halsin
147.text: My heart soars just to look upon you. What do you need?
147.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner

288.speaker: Halsin
288.text: You wish to speak? I am here for you.
288.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner

278.speaker: Player
278.text: How are you? You weren't harmed when Orin took you, I hope?
278.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

340.speaker: Player
340.text: Are you still content at my side? This doesn't have to be your fight, and it's certainly not your typical habitat.
340.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

418.speaker: Player
418.text: Have you had any contact with Thaniel since we left him?
418.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I am sorry about Yenna. I wish things had gone differently.
3.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Poor Yenna... How are you holding up?
166.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

325.speaker: Player
325.text: I don't think those two drow will be forgetting us in a hurry.
325.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: I don't think those two drow will be forgetting us in a hurry.
251.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

405.speaker: Player
405.text: I just wanted to see how you were faring.
405.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

399.speaker: Halsin
399.text: With the end upon us? So long as I am surviving, and I have you by my side, I am faring as well as anyone can be.
399.context: NodeContext: to love interest player during the climactic sequence of the game.

390.speaker: Halsin
390.text: My mind still drifts to that dream I shared with you, for a better future for all those who need it... but that must wait. I remain yours, of course. Ready when you need me.
390.context: NodeContext: Slightly distracted by world events, but glad to be with the player (romantic partner)

26.speaker: Halsin
26.text: This city troubles me... but I am here for you. I want to be by your side, and see this through.
26.context: NodeContext: Slightly distracted by world events, but glad to be with the player (romantic partner)

38.speaker: Halsin
38.text: This place is... not for me, perhaps. But with you by my side, and the shadow curse a fading memory, I shall keep my head high.
38.context: NodeContext: Slightly distracted by world events, but glad to be with the player (romantic partner)

476.speaker: Halsin
476.text: We have challenges to surmount, of course, but with you by my side, my heart stays strong.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: How do you see our relationship?

249.speaker: Halsin
249.text: You should feel free to roam as your heart desires. You are all I want, but I will not hoard you to myself. Let others know the happiness of being with you.

383.speaker: Halsin
383.text: Relationship? Such terms belong to civilisation - a little unfamiliar to my lips. You know what we share is more fluid, more founded in the principles of nature.

459.speaker: Halsin
459.text: Indeed, I am but one of your lovers. You and I should each seek happiness, wherever it lies. You are all I want, but I will not hoard you to myself. Let others know the happiness of being with you.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: Have you received any word from the grove since the Rite of Thorns?
186.context: NodeContext: Enthused/romantic. Love interest player asked for a kiss.

419.speaker: Player
419.context: NodeContext: Enthused/romantic. Love interest player asked for a kiss.

339.speaker: Player
339.context: NodeContext: Enthused/romantic. Love interest player asked for a kiss.

295.speaker: Halsin
295.text: No hardship for me. Far from it.
295.context: NodeContext: Enthused/romantic. Love interest player asked for a kiss.

107.speaker: Halsin
107.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.

420.speaker: Halsin
420.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.

49.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.
49.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

182.speaker: Halsin
182.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.
182.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

216.speaker: Player
216.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.
216.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.
124.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

169.speaker: Lae'zel
169.text: Pucker and peck all you like. Don't assume I care to watch.
169.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

258.speaker: Shadowheart
258.text: My... some bard could write a stirring love poem about you two. Or a lewd tavern ballad, perhaps.
258.context: NodeContext: Gentle teasing, Player is kissing Halsin, their love interest, in full view of the group

291.speaker: Astarion
291.text: Don't mind me. I'm just enjoying the show.
291.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

184.speaker: Wyll
184.text: A charming couple. I think my heart just grew two sizes.
184.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

261.speaker: Gale
261.text: It's a wonderful feeling, to care for someone so deeply. Treasure it.
261.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

149.speaker: Karlach
149.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

32.speaker: Jaheira
32.text: Brave. I can never quite trust my breath after taking the beast-form.
32.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Was there something else you wanted, my heart?
219.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

98.speaker: Halsin
98.text: Was there something else you wanted, my heart?
98.context: NodeContext: Addressed to love interest player

333.speaker: Minsc
333.text: Oh, do not be such a cynic, Boo.
333.context: NodeContext: Preceded by a Boo squeak in response to seeing Halsin and the avatar share a kiss.

466.speaker: Player
466.text: I think our relationship has run its course.

210.speaker: Halsin
210.text: You have said as much to me before, only to change your mind. I told you your heart is your own, but I do not wish for mine to be toyed with. Are you certain?

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: I see... if that is truly your desire, then I shall respect it. No matter how much I wish it was not the case.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I am sorry, but it's over between us.

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: Then... very well. This chapter is at an end. I can only hope you have many more, each filled with happiness.

231.speaker: Halsin
231.text: I will remain by your side whenever you wish, of course. As ally, advisor, friend... in any way you desire, save for as a lover.

173.speaker: Player
173.text: I've changed my mind - I still want to be with you.
173.context: NodeContext: Terse. Angry with a lover who has repeatedly broached the subject of breaking up, only to swerve away from it.

305.speaker: Halsin
305.text: Does it please you to see me crestfallen? That is the only reason I can think why you might toy with my heart like this.
305.context: NodeContext: Terse. Angry with a lover who has repeatedly broached the subject of breaking up, only to swerve away from it.

174.speaker: Halsin
174.text: I am glad you have reconsidered, but please don't trivially bring up such difficult topics. My heart can be wounded just like any other.
174.context: NodeContext: Relieved/ a little resentful at being toyed with

154.speaker: Player
154.text: My memories are all gone. Did your research into the tadpoles suggest that might be a symptom?

268.speaker: Player
268.text: I yearn to kill. I only feel like myself when I'm killing.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I have been gifted with the Slayer, a form most evil.

378.speaker: Player
378.text: I understand my affliction at last - I am a Bhaalspawn. The Lord of Murder compels me.

275.speaker: Player
275.text: My affliction is no more - I'm finally free.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Bhaal has chosen me to conquer all of existence in his name. You would be wise to bow.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: I wanted to speak to you about the night we spent together.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I wanted to speak to you about the night we spent together.

283.speaker: Halsin
283.text: That was something I had dreamed about for some time... and now I realise just how woefully meagre my dreams were, compared to the reality.

246.speaker: Halsin
246.text: I would still be there with you now, if the sun hadn't intruded on us, and the city hadn't stirred for the day.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: I'd been dreaming about that as well. It was perfect.

255.speaker: Halsin
255.text: No, don't say that. Perfect would mean there is nothing left to explore.

185.speaker: Halsin
185.text: And I see plenty to lose myself in.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I would have stayed. The populace could do with a show. Take their minds off things.

356.speaker: Halsin
356.text: I had heard the municipal laws regarding large animals had been struck down... but still, perhaps we were wise to not push our luck. This time.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Perhaps a bed next time. Just to be different.

309.speaker: Halsin
309.text: I am open to anything - if you can find a piece of furniture that is up to the challenge.

423.speaker: Player
423.text: I feel closer to nature, now that nature's been inside me.

317.speaker: Halsin
317.text: We were as one. The warmth of your skin, the feel of your...

156.speaker: Halsin
156.text: ...I must be careful, or I'll lose the run of myself again. An Archdruid should show some restraint.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: It was intense. In a good way.

319.speaker: Halsin
319.text: Are you sure? Holding back is not in my nature, but I would not wish to alarm you, or harm you.

430.speaker: Player
430.text: Don't worry. I have strong tastes and a big appetite.

220.speaker: Halsin
220.text: As I discovered. It isn't so often that the bear is the one being eyed hungrily.

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: Perhaps fate will afford us more time together - I hope it does.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It was certainly different. But I have no regrets.

468.speaker: Halsin
468.text: Nor I. At my age, I've come to see that little is worth regretting in the long run, apart from regrets themselves.

441.speaker: Player
441.text: We're all adults here. Though some of us may be walking a little stiffly for a while...

247.speaker: Halsin
247.text: I can imagine. You rode out the storm most admirably.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I don't think we can do this again.

438.speaker: Halsin
438.text: Of course... That is your right.

105.speaker: Halsin
105.text: A short night, at that. I am sorry if I came on too strongly. Take all the time and space you require.

25.speaker: Halsin
25.text: Perhaps our time has not yet come. Perhaps dealing with the Absolute must come first. Whatever you decide, I will understand.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: We'll have our moment, don't worry.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Let's take things slowly, for now.

454.speaker: Player
454.text: Perhaps this was all a mistake. I don't think we should continue.

433.speaker: Player
433.text: Consider telling him the truth - that you worship Lady Shar.

139.speaker: Player
139.text: I need you by my side.

328.speaker: Player
328.text: I need you to remain at camp for now.

300.speaker: Halsin
300.text: When I first met you, saving yourself from ceremorphosis was your greatest wish... yet now you have stepped closer to embracing it.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: I hope this does not prove to be a mistake, my love.
7.context: NodeContext: Concerned about a drastic step a lover has taken

214.speaker: Halsin
214.text: I trust your leadership, and respect your decisions... but I truly hope this is not something we come to regret.

344.speaker: Player
344.text: How are you? You weren't harmed when Orin took you, I hope?

263.speaker: Halsin
263.text: Just my pride - I can't believe I allowed myself to be knocked unconscious and spirited away like that...

106.speaker: Halsin
106.text: Impressive that she managed to move my bulk, come to think of it. I wonder how that was managed.

217.speaker: Halsin
217.text: But in either case, it seems I was insensible for much of my ordeal. Small mercies.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Are you still content at my side? This doesn't have to be your fight, and it's certainly not your typical habitat.
155.context: NodeContext: Betraying some discomfort, but still steadfast to his promise.

180.speaker: Halsin
180.text: The city, you mean? With all its noise, smoke, stone, and bustle? I would not be here, given the choice... but I promised you my support. And that is what you shall have.
180.context: NodeContext: Betraying some discomfort, but still steadfast to his promise.

393.speaker: Halsin
393.text: Still, though... this place crawls with life, but little of it flourishes. I see refugees, unhoused. The destitute, unwanted. Orphans, unloved.

190.speaker: Halsin
190.text: The city is like a forest with an overgrown canopy. Light and nourishment cannot penetrate to those who need it the most...

102.speaker: Halsin
102.text: ...and still it draws them in. The safety of numbers. The promise of civilisation. The dream of better.

387.speaker: Halsin
387.text: All that potential is too often destined to die in the dark, and rot in the gutter.
387.context: NodeContext: Wistful. Thinking of a dream he's not sure will ever be fulfilled.

352.speaker: Halsin
352.text: I wish... I wish there was a better way. I wish everyone could see the sun, have a full belly, and know nature as a friend. There is a balance that is yet to be found.
352.context: NodeContext: Wistful. Thinking of a dream he's not sure will ever be fulfilled.

202.speaker: Halsin
202.text: Listen to me, preaching like an initiate in his cups.

208.speaker: Player
208.text: It's a fine dream. Perhaps you can help find the balance.

243.speaker: Halsin
243.text: Yes... I hope so. But we have a battle to win, before any of that.

397.speaker: Player
397.text: I didn't expect such naivety in an Archdruid of your vintage.

122.speaker: Halsin
122.text: I outgrew cynicism around the age of 200. I offer no apologies for my desires.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: The city isn't perfect, but neither is nature. It's dangerous to idealise one thing at the expense of another.

458.speaker: Halsin
458.text: You are right. But such... drastic times can make it difficult to preserve nuance in one's thinking. Further reflection is needed.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Tough choices lie ahead. This is no time for bleeding hearts.
111.context: NodeContext: A little terse. Player insinuated he was being soft.

270.speaker: Halsin
270.text: I shall not falter from what must be done, but I cannot ignore what I see, either.
270.context: NodeContext: A little terse. Player insinuated he was being soft.

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: Perhaps, but words alone are not enough...

354.speaker: Halsin
354.text: But that must wait for now - there are battles yet to be fought. We must save the world before we can dream of ways to better it.

404.speaker: Player
404.text: This is my home you're talking about - it's not some pit of despair.

189.speaker: Halsin
189.text: Some can thrive here, yes. But it was never meant for everyone. There should be a choice. Nature should be afforded its chance to offer harmony to those who need it.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Have you heard from Thaniel since we moved on?

143.speaker: Halsin
143.text: I have. He speaks to me during my nightly meditations.

313.speaker: Halsin
313.text: He is well - and Oliver also. At times they are one, and at others they divide. Easier for playing, perhaps. And the land thrives also. I doubt you would recognise it.

11.speaker: Halsin
11.text: Perhaps one day you and I can both return, and see it for ourselves.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I am sorry about Yenna. I wish things had gone differently.
82.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful, but understanding (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

93.speaker: Halsin
93.text: You thought she was an imposter - a threat. This was a trap of Orin's creation. Yenna's death is on her hands, not yours.
93.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful, but understanding (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

224.speaker: Halsin
224.text: But still... we all failed that little girl.
224.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

46.speaker: Halsin
46.text: Killing Orin won't bring Yenna back, but it may give her some peace, and me... a great deal of satisfaction.
46.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful/hint of anger (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Can Oliver even be found, after what happened? Our chances of lifting the curse may be ruined...
171.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

413.speaker: Halsin
413.text: Perhaps not - if he truly is a part of Thaniel, then he is beyond life and death. More likely he's just hiding. We should return to where you saw him.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Poor Yenna... How are you holding up?
55.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

205.speaker: Halsin
205.text: I thought we would be able to help her. I thought we would be able to keep her safe.
205.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

88.speaker: Halsin
88.text: No matter how long I live, I will never get used to the cruelties that infest our world. That such evil is allowed to breathe the same air as us is an abomination.
88.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

442.speaker: Halsin
442.text: There must be no more Yennas.
442.context: NodeContext: Sorrowful/determined (Yenna was an orphan girl who sheltered at the player's camp)

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I don't think those two drow will be forgetting us in a hurry.

296.speaker: Halsin
296.text: Indeed. Our time with them was... certainly bracing. Takes me back to some youthful misadventures in the Underdark.

434.speaker: Player
434.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

361.speaker: Halsin
361.text: Very much so. One positive I will concede about city life is that you never know what lies around the corner.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You mentioned something about the Underdark?

371.speaker: Player
371.text: I was concerned the City Watch might burst in on us, with the sounds we made.
371.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

136.speaker: Halsin
136.text: I am sure they are well used to it. Cramped streets and thin walls make for people adept at ignoring things. You could find yourself more alone in a city than in the deepest woods.

386.speaker: Player
386.text: I was concerned the City Watch might burst in on us, thinking a bear was running amok, devouring flesh.
386.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

198.speaker: Halsin
198.text: Well, in a sense, there was. But no harm done. In fact, one of the drow looked like he was going to pay us towards the end.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: You mentioned the Underdark before - come on, tell me about it.
320.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Misadventures in the Underdark? Come on, tell me all.
36.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: It was a long time ago. I was a foolhardy young druid, intent on seeing the beauty of nature's unworldly fauna and subterranean glow for myself...
48.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

150.speaker: Halsin
150.text: Certain... events transpired, and I found myself a guest of a noble drow house for a time. Well, something between guest, prisoner, and consort, perhaps.
150.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

382.speaker: Player
382.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

462.speaker: Halsin
462.text: The house matron took an interest in me, and the patron also... They saw me as a novelty, perhaps. I was chained in their bedchamber for nigh on three years.
462.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

114.speaker: Player
114.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

157.speaker: Halsin
157.text: It was not ideal... but not without its positives either. I did what was necessary to survive. And perhaps a few things that were less than necessary.
157.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

253.speaker: Player
253.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

41.speaker: Halsin
41.text: I waited for my chance, and did what was necessary to survive. And perhaps a few things that were less than necessary.
41.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

116.speaker: Halsin
116.text: Don't misunderstand me - I feared for my life, and wanted my freedom back, but I was willing to wait for my moment, and eventually it came.
116.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

391.speaker: Halsin
391.text: Lolth's noble houses are constantly at each other's throats, and eventually, some rivals of my hosts sought to unseat them.
391.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: It was chaos - drow against drow, the clash of blades echoing throughout caverns, the feel of warm blood that I could not see...
43.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

172.speaker: Halsin
172.text: ...I took my chance and fled while all were distracted. I never looked back until I breathed fresh air again, and never learned what came of my hosts.
172.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

323.speaker: Player
323.text: Sounds traumatic. You may need to reflect on that.

21.speaker: Halsin
21.text: Time can prove to be a trickster on one's recollections - what would be multiple lifetimes for others now separate me from my captivity... perhaps I have lost perspective on what happened to me.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Indeed. Confusing slavery with a fond memory is quite the shift in perspective.

474.speaker: Halsin
474.text: Apologies, I meant no offence. I survived, and in years to come, I must have allowed hardships to become dwarfed by the Shadow Curse in my mind.

269.speaker: Halsin
269.text: I lost friends, confidantes, and had the weight of responsibility bear down on me unrelentingly. There was scant opportunity for self-reflection...

92.speaker: Halsin
92.text: I am lucky to have your counsel. It was sorely needed.

381.speaker: Halsin
381.text: Lolth's noble houses are constantly at each other's throats, and eventually, the house that held me fell out of favour, and was attacked.

33.speaker: Halsin
33.text: It was chaos - drow against drow, the clash of blades echoing throughout caverns, the feel of warm blood that I could not see...

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: ...I took my chance and fled while all were distracted. I never looked back until I breathed fresh air again, and never learned what came of my hosts.

332.speaker: Halsin
332.text: No - I shall not take you for granted, nor my own past. What is the point of long life, if one does not make room for reflection?

130.speaker: Player
130.text: It's not for me to say - I wasn't there. But I'm here now, if you wish to talk.

369.speaker: Halsin
369.text: I... have not had true confidantes for some time. The Shadow Curse robbed me of almost all my peers, and replaced them with the weight of responsibility. Perhaps that caused me to gild undeserving memories of my youth.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: You have a habit of getting captured - did you ever notice that?

307.speaker: Halsin
307.text: I am aware. Perhaps I put too much faith in my skills of negotiation, or want to see good where there is none.

392.speaker: Halsin
392.text: It would be easy to resort to nature's fury whenever something stood in my way, yet I cannot help but feel I would be sullying the Oak Father's gifts. Naive perhaps... but I still draw breath.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: The mighty bear is an escaped pet, then. I wonder if there is a reward for your return.

358.speaker: Halsin
358.text: You would be unwise to attempt it, trust me. In any case, the house of my captors is long-extinct.

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: ... interesting. Part of me still thought of them as hosts, but I suppose captors is indeed more accurate.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: Lolth's followers are pitiless. You threaded the needle by surviving.

22.speaker: Halsin
22.text: Perhaps that is so. It has been so long that I may have forgotten the peril that I faced.

432.speaker: Player
432.text: I remember you spoke harshly about drow once. Perhaps this explains that.

153.speaker: Halsin
153.text: Indeed... perhaps I carry more resentment than I realise.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I'm surprised you survived at all.
17.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: It was touch-and-go for a while...
4.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm not sure if this is a fond memory or a cautionary tale.
35.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

312.speaker: Halsin
312.text: The passage of time has a strange way of polishing even the most arduous of memories into precious keepsakes. Had circumstances been slightly different, I may have been put to work in mines, or killed outright.
312.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Some drow abhor surface elves. I'm surprised your pelt didn't end up decorating a banquet hall in Menzoberranzan.
66.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

188.speaker: Halsin
188.text: A very likely outcome - in fact I saw decorations of that very type, and worse, in my time there. But my luck held.
188.context: NodeContext: Recounting an episode from a lively youth. Neither bragging nor ashamed

409.speaker: Player
409.text: I don't think those two drow will be forgetting us in a hurry.

374.speaker: Player
374.text: I don't think those two drow will be forgetting us in a hurry.

464.speaker: Halsin
464.text: Indeed. Thank you for inviting me. I hadn't realised you considered me a worthy accomplice in such matters. I hope you'll keep me in mind, in future.

244.speaker: Halsin
244.text: Our time with those two drow was... certainly bracing. Takes me back to some youthful misadventures in the Underdark.

362.speaker: Player
362.text: There are wildflowers growing by an old shack, deep in the shadow curse.
362.context: NodeContext: alert and intrigued - the breakthrough he's been waiting for

364.speaker: Halsin
364.text: Flowers in bloom where nothing else grows...? That is a sign of Thaniel's power - it must be.
364.context: NodeContext: alert and intrigued - the breakthrough he's been waiting for

314.speaker: Halsin
314.text: The missing part of him must be near there. We need to search that area.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: You said Thaniel is missing part of himself - any ideas how we can find it?
158.context: NodeContext: Grave. They'll have to effectively kill a child to save a child.

284.speaker: Halsin
284.text: No matter how it's been twisted by the shadows, it is still part of Thaniel's essence - it will resemble him somehow, and may show signs of his power.
284.context: NodeContext: Grave. They'll have to effectively kill a child to save a child.

355.speaker: Halsin
355.text: Look for signs of life in the darkness. Wildflowers, where everything else is dead. The curse cannot subdue the power Thaniel bears. Not entirely.
355.context: NodeContext: Grave. They'll have to effectively kill a child to save a child.

206.speaker: Halsin
206.text: In fact, I think I saw just the sort before, not long after we first came within reach of the shadow curse. Fool that I am, I did not grasp their significance at the time.
206.context: NodeContext: Moment of realisation. Kicking himself a bit for not putting 2 + 2 together earlier

384.speaker: Halsin
384.text: There is a ruin, some way outside of Last Light. I caught a glimpse of fresh blooms there, but did not investigate further. I shall mark it upon your map.
384.context: NodeContext: Eager/determined. They have a promising lead

233.speaker: Player
233.text: I met a peer of yours - the druid Jaheira. Do you know her?

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: Only by reputation. She was present when we marched against Ketheric Thorm, but on the far end of the battle lines from where I fought.

151.speaker: Halsin
151.text: And in the chaos that ensued, well... our forces were scattered. I led some to safety, but never learned of her fate. I'm glad to hear she survived.

266.speaker: Halsin
266.text: Though in truth, I should not be surprised - she was always said to be formidable - and cunning. I could have learned much from her, no doubt.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: You're an Archdruid - what could you possibly have left to learn from anyone?

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: No matter how long I live, I will always strive to remain a keen pupil. Only a fool would think he could drink in all knowledge until none is left. There is always more - nature's tapestry is infinitely complex.

232.speaker: Player
232.text: You seem to admire her greatly.

227.speaker: Halsin
227.text: There is much to admire, judging by the stories.

302.speaker: Halsin
302.text: I cannot help but wonder how she would have handled some of the challenges I faced as Archdruid. Defended the grove? Kagha? The Shadow Druids?

240.speaker: Halsin
240.text: I cannot help but wonder how she would have handled some of the challenges I faced as Archdruid. Perhaps the Rite of Thorns could have been avoided. It is hard to say.

159.speaker: Halsin
159.text: I cannot help but wonder how she would have handled some of the challenges I faced as Archdruid. Would she have helped the refugees? Defended the grove? Controlled Kagha?

84.speaker: Halsin
84.text: At least now we can benefit from her presence, and perhaps work to a common goal.

349.speaker: Player
349.text: I'm glad we have Jaheira travelling with us. Did you know her from before?
349.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

471.speaker: Player
471.text: You've spent all these years fighting the shadow curse - what happens once it's lifted?
471.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

78.speaker: Halsin
78.text: Honestly, I never thought I'd make it that far. But the Absolute is a threat to all, and I promised I'd help you with your parasite.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

218.speaker: Halsin
218.text: So, I'll remain with you - if you'll have me, that is.
218.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

465.speaker: Player
465.text: Of course. I only wish you'd joined me earlier.
465.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

276.speaker: Halsin
276.text: So do I. But one duty at a time.

460.speaker: Player
460.text: You'll make a decent workhorse. This camp doesn't haul itself around each day.
460.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

76.speaker: Halsin
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Amused chuckleNodeContext: Amused chuckle

229.speaker: Player
229.text: I'll see how useful you prove to be.

199.speaker: Halsin
199.text: Hmm, well, I can only hope I don't disappoint.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: On that note, I need you to stay at camp for now.

407.speaker: Halsin
407.text: Hmm... it seems the way to camp is unavailable to me just now.

427.speaker: Player
427.text: Actually, never mind. Stay with me.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: I'll find you when I need you.

103.speaker: Halsin
103.text: I'll be right here in camp. Take care out there.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: You know where to find me. Take care.

254.speaker: Player
254.text: Have you received any word from the grove since the Rite of Thorns?

285.speaker: Halsin
285.text: None - the grove has cut itself off from the world, to jealously guard its own little pocket of nature. No one shall ever enter or leave again.

117.speaker: Halsin
117.text: And I have been evicted from the very place I was charged to safeguard. A telling summary of my time as Archdruid, perhaps...

396.speaker: Halsin
396.text: Still, perhaps I can yet serve nature in another way, once our journey has ended. I can only pray that the Oak Father grants me new purpose.

330.speaker: Player
330.text: How am I holding up in your estimations?

191.speaker: Halsin
191.text: I've been unfair to you - I've had unrealistic expectations of your character ever since I joined you...

411.speaker: Halsin
411.text: ...but honestly? You've surpassed even those. Seems my faith was more than well-founded.

81.speaker: Halsin
81.text: Given the circumstances? You're faring as well as can be expected, I suppose.

380.speaker: Halsin
380.text: Honestly...? I'd hoped for more from you. But perhaps things can yet be turned around.

299.speaker: Halsin
299.text: Don't worry yourself about what I think just yet - we may not have spent much time in each other's company yet, but I joined you because your judgement seems sound.
299.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if no approval check is valid.

469.speaker: Player
469.text: I feel like I haven't gotten to know you properly yet.

212.speaker: Halsin
212.text: It's true, and I can't imagine I helped with that. Sometimes I let the task at hand consume me, and people think I'm obsessed.

100.speaker: Halsin
100.text: Trust me, the day I no longer have to talk about the shadow curse will be a happy one. What would you like to know?

277.speaker: Player
277.text: Don't take this the wrong way, but you're quite large for an elf.

193.speaker: Halsin
193.text: Trust me, it's been said. You've shown more restraint than most in avoiding the subject until now.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: Any idea how that came about?

131.speaker: Halsin
131.text: Who is to say? Perhaps there's a half-orc buried somewhere in my ancestry?

177.speaker: Halsin
177.text: Or perhaps not - sometimes I think conventional wisdom is too narrow about what someone can or cannot be. Stranger things have most certainly happened.

385.speaker: Player
385.text: We don't have to talk about it, if you don't want to.

264.speaker: Halsin
264.text: It's a natural question, but I don't have a good answer, I'm afraid. Perhaps there's a half-orc buried somewhere in my ancestry.

375.speaker: Player
375.text: How did you come to be a druid?
375.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: I had a friend when I was young, long ago. He played with me in the forests where I grew up... but eventually, I realised no one else had heard of him.

449.speaker: Halsin
449.text: It was Thaniel, of course. Nature was my very first friend. I get older, but he hasn't changed a day.

267.speaker: Halsin
267.text: I knew then that I had to be more than a companion to him. I had to be a protector.

422.speaker: Player
422.text: Do you have people out there somewhere? Family? Friends? A lover, perhaps?
422.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

448.speaker: Halsin
448.text: You're not a doppelganger, are you? Trying to study me, learn all my secrets so you can take my place?
448.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

326.speaker: Halsin
326.text: Save for me, my line perished a long time ago. They rest in High Forest now, near the shade of the Grandfather Tree. The grove became my family, with Silvanus as my teacher. And now, I have you.
326.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

146.speaker: Player
146.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: It was a long time ago. The wounds don't heal, but they become more bearable.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: You're better off with me anyway.
311.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

416.speaker: Halsin
416.text: I hope so. But I won't turn my back on the past - it made me who am I today.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You didn't answer the part about lovers.
87.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

455.speaker: Halsin
455.text: I'm 350 years old. Of course there have been lovers. Just because I love nature doesn't mean I'm betrothed to it. Though sometimes, nature needs reminding...
455.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

443.speaker: Player
443.text: Don't leave me hanging - is there someone in your life right now?
443.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

200.speaker: Halsin
200.text: Right now? I bed down alone, I'm afraid. Perhaps once I talk less of curses and parasites, my fortunes will improve.
200.context: NodeContext: A little cheeky, a little self-deprecating

327.speaker: Player
327.text: Hold on - nature needs reminding of what exactly?

388.speaker: Halsin
388.text: Well, I didn't pick this scar up in battle. I was in wildshape, only I forgot it was the season when bears are particularly social. A she-bear claimed me as her own - and did not appreciate being spurned.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: You have me? Let's not get carried away - circumstance brought us together.

289.speaker: Halsin
289.text: The same's true of everyone, I find.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Tell me something about yourself that I wouldn't even think to ask.

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: Hmm, I suppose you wouldn't be shocked to learn I love animals and nature?

298.speaker: Halsin
298.text: I know, I know; well-trodden territory. Well, let's see... I whittle in my spare time, and I've something of a sweet tooth - though everyone's very amused when I say I like honey.
298.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

335.speaker: Player
335.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

67.speaker: Halsin
67.text: Ornaments, utensils - and ducks. I like ducks.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: So you turn into a bear and you like honey? A little on the nose.
324.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: I like what I like. Once you get to my age, you realise there's little point in denying yourself, so long as others aren't affected.

301.speaker: Player
301.text: You're fortunate to know what you like. I wouldn't pay any attention to what others think.
301.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

461.speaker: Halsin
461.text: You're right. Sometimes I think people look at me and imagine my feelings can't be hurt.

225.speaker: Player
225.text: As you've mentioned it, how old are you anyway?
225.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

360.speaker: Halsin
360.text: 350 years young. I've been privileged to watch saplings grow into mighty boughs.

475.speaker: Player
475.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: Thank me by returning the favour, why don't you? Come on - I've sure you've got something better than carving wooden ducks.
10.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: I despise sunsets, slow wits - and small talk.
245.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: Luckily there's nothing small about getting to know someone like you. There's little occasion for frivolity in nature - I can appreciate your stance... even if others do not.
19.context: NodeContext: Open-minded and unfazed by Lae'zel's gruff response.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: I've always wanted a child of my own. Perhaps one day, when peace visits the Coast.
359.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smiles wistfully on 'duty, eh?'NodeContext: A little wistful. 'I get it' smile on 'duty, eh?'

444.speaker: Halsin
444.text: I think I know how you feel... duty, eh? I hope your wish comes true. We'll need new life once all this is over.
444.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smiles wistfully on 'duty, eh?'NodeContext: A little wistful. 'I get it' smile on 'duty, eh?'

322.speaker: Player
322.text: Well, I have something of a soft spot for animals... though I've never had a pet, that I'm aware of.

363.speaker: Halsin
363.text: Ha! Pet ownership is an illusion - nature's creatures choose their own companions. No one has true mastery over them in the end. As it should be.

373.speaker: Halsin
373.text: But it heartens me to learn you and I share the same admiration.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I cast my first spell whilst still a babe. My mother took an awful fright when I conjured up a score of rabbits in the pantry.

109.speaker: Halsin
109.text: Ha! Talented from the beginning, then? Almost a surprise you didn't cast magic in the womb.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Maybe I have a sweet tooth too.
52.context: NodeContext: Droll (in response to a vampire indicating they might have a sweet tooth.

367.speaker: Halsin
367.text: Is that so? Would you seek to drizzle honey on a neck before indulging?
367.context: NodeContext: Droll (in response to a vampire indicating they might have a sweet tooth.

447.speaker: Player
447.text: When I first got to the Hells, I was so scared and lonely I adopted a pet rock. Named it Crag.

304.speaker: Halsin
304.text: Ah, but there are no pets in nature - only companions. Though I'll admit Crag likely made for a rather stoic confidante...

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I live in mortal fear of krakens, though I've never actually seen one.

74.speaker: Halsin
74.text: Well they are fierce creatures from what I understand... but as long as you avoid the high seas, I think you can consider yourself safe.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I really don't know very much about myself to tell.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: Nothing half as charming as that... it's all crimson and rot.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I don't think there's anything worth sharing.

112.speaker: Halsin
112.text: Oh. Well, your choice, of course.

426.speaker: Halsin
426.text: Thank me by returning the favour, why don't you? Come on - I've sure you've got all sorts you could tell me.

472.speaker: Halsin
472.text: What would you like to know?

389.speaker: Player
389.text: What happened before, when the shadow curse was unleashed?

357.speaker: Halsin
357.text: Druids and Harpers joined together to put a stop to Ketheric Thorm. We marched on Moonrise and, after much fighting, we prevailed.

187.speaker: Halsin
187.text: Even in defeat, though, Ketheric turned to Shar. Not long after we sealed him away in his tomb, the shadow curse took hold. No one had seen the likes of it before. No one knew how to react...

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: ...Then it started to claim all those within its reach. Those who had survived the battles now fell to the shadows - became part of the shadows. And worst of all... I lost contact with Thaniel.

470.speaker: Halsin
470.text: I wanted to try and find him, but we couldn't stay - we would have all succumbed. When the Archdruid of the Grove - my predecessor - was seized by the curse, I had to lead the survivors to safety.

279.speaker: Halsin
279.text: That was my first day as Archdruid. An inauspicious beginning.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Inauspicious? Sounds like you did what you had to, and saved lives.
192.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point, but remains hard on himself

129.speaker: Halsin
129.text: You are right. But I must not lose focus until everything has been put right. I've wasted too much time already - years in which nature has suffered.
129.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point, but remains hard on himself

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Not every day as a leader can be a glorious one.

152.speaker: Halsin
152.text: Indeed. I know that all too well.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: That's in the past. You've faced the curse, and rescued Thaniel from the Shadowfell.
181.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point, but remains hard on himself

401.speaker: Halsin
401.text: You're right. But the work is not yet done - not while Ketheric Thorm still draws breath.
401.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point, but remains hard on himself

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Thaniel is safe, Ketheric is dead, and soon the curse will be no more. You have nothing left to prove.
164.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point. He's helped do a lot of good.

412.speaker: Halsin
412.text: You're right. I should not let the failures of the past sour the victories of the present. We have achieved something immense here.
412.context: NodeContext: Conceding a point. He's helped do a lot of good.

235.speaker: Halsin
235.text: I will never forget your part in this. Nor will Thaniel.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Consider telling him the truth - that you worship Lady Shar.

207.speaker: Narrator
207.text: *Surely he will understand. You've developed a strong bond with him already... but perhaps you've waited too long? The revelation could damage the trust you've built.*

262.speaker: Narrator
262.text: *How might he take it? Difficult to say. You have some rapport with him, but is it enough? You won't know for sure until you tell him...*

402.speaker: Narrator
402.text: *A terrible idea, surely. He barely tolerates you as it is - the chances that he'll show understanding are vanishingly slim.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Take a deep breath and confess the truth to Halsin. You are a worshipper of Lady Shar.

71.speaker: Halsin
71.text: I see... Foolhardy, perhaps, to reveal such a thing to a veteran of battles against Shar worshippers. Foolhardy... or brave.

429.speaker: Halsin
429.text: I have no love for your goddess, or the foul things she unleashed upon nature. But I can appreciate your honesty. There is nobility in your conduct, if not in your allegiance.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Take a deep breath and confess the truth to Halsin. You are a worshipper of Lady Shar.

213.speaker: Halsin
213.text: A Shar worshipper... I see. It can't have been easy for you to tell me such a thing, given my history. But I am glad you took the plunge.

425.speaker: Halsin
425.text: A Shar worshipper... I see. It can't have been easy for you to tell me such a thing, given my history. But I am glad you took the plunge.

316.text: A Shar worshipper... I see. Perhaps you feared how I would react, but still... you should have told me sooner.

230.speaker: Halsin
230.text: A Shar worshipper... I see. Perhaps you feared how I would react, but still... you should have told me sooner.

366.speaker: Halsin
366.text: You were not even born when Shar's followers slew my fellow druids, or when her shadow curse tainted the land. I can get past those... but I truly wish you had trusted me sooner.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: Take a deep breath and confess the truth to Halsin. You are a worshipper of Lady Shar.

195.speaker: Halsin
195.text: You worship Shar? That umbral witch unleashed a plague of darkness on nature - her followers slew many of my fellow druids.

257.text: You worship Shar? That umbral witch unleashed a plague of darkness on nature - her followers slew many of my fellow druids.

51.speaker: Halsin
51.text: You worship Shar? That umbral witch unleashed a plague of darkness on nature - her followers slew many of my fellow druids.

256.speaker: Halsin
256.text: You are lucky that we share common purpose. In most other cases, this revelation would put us on opposite sides of the battlefield.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Change your mind. The truth can wait a while yet.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: My memories are all gone. Did your research into the tadpoles suggest that might be a symptom?

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: No... nothing of the sort. But that is not to say it isn't connected. Best be careful, all the same.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: I yearn to kill. I only feel like myself when I'm killing.

439.speaker: Halsin
439.text: The urge to kill is common in nature - for some creatures it is the core of their being... Still, though, you seem to speak of a darker impulse. Be careful how it manifests itself.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I have been gifted with the Slayer, a form most evil.

377.speaker: Halsin
377.text: Most unnatural. Most foul. Nature is a cycle of life and death, yet this form only serves death. Worse - it only serves murder.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I understand my affliction at last - I am a Bhaalspawn. The Lord of Murder compels me.

161.speaker: Halsin
161.text: You are a mortal child of Bhaal? Be careful with whom you share that fact - I hear many of your kind have met premature ends.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: My affliction is no more - I'm finally free.

204.speaker: Halsin
204.text: And a hard-won freedom at that. Well done.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Bhaal has chosen me to conquer all of existence in his name. You would be wise to bow.

209.speaker: Halsin
209.text: Nature bows to none. It will fight on and survive, no matter what madness your god has inspired you to undertake.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I need you by my side.
128.context: NodeContext: Twinkle of wry humour as he acknowledges he's big

293.speaker: Halsin
293.text: It seems like you've no room for me just now - and I take up no small amount of space.
293.context: NodeContext: Twinkle of wry humour as he acknowledges he's big

239.speaker: Halsin
239.text: It seems like you've no room for me just now - and I take up no small amount of space.
239.context: NodeContext: Twinkle of wry humour as he acknowledges he's big

341.speaker: Halsin
341.text: Then you'll have me. Lead on.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: I need you to remain at camp for now.

348.speaker: Halsin
348.text: We need to keep our guard up - those brigands got too close to use for my liking.
348.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner (secondary partner in a polyamorous relationship, but Halsin makes no real distinction in status)

350.speaker: Halsin
350.text: We need to keep our guard up - those brigands got too close to use for my liking.
350.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner (secondary partner in a polyamorous relationship, but Halsin makes no real distinction in status)

376.speaker: Halsin
376.context: NodeContext: Warm/romantic greetings, addressing his partner (secondary partner in a polyamorous relationship, but Halsin makes no real distinction in status)

379.speaker: Halsin
379.text: Oak Father, grant me patience... what do you want?
379.context: NodeContext: Terse (dislikes the player/has low approval of them)

406.speaker: Halsin
406.text: I'm afraid there's not much I can say - I've sworn confidence to someone already.
406.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if a non-avatar tries to speak to Halsin.

446.speaker: Halsin
446.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.

395.speaker: Halsin
395.context: NodeContext: Medium intensity - this is a 'backfill node' we want so we can use it to patch holes we might find in our dialogues at a later date if needed. Therefore, the context is very broad.
